artisanzero wrote:

>If you were shown a project plan, told that unit tests weren't worked 
>into the schedule, but that they should be, and asked what percentage 
>of time should be added - what would you say. 
>

I'd say: Next time can we give input to the project plan?

Seriously, without some benchmark how can I expect that any number I 
offer will be correct?  I'd rather just assume any number I give will be 
wrong and defer giving an estimate until after building some small 
portion of the system.  That is, I can't tell you how much extra time 
writing unit tests takes, but I can tell you how long it took us to 
build this much software with unit tests.  

Let the delivery of working software speak for itself.  Everything else 
is speculation.       

Mike
